author: Staff Reporter
text:
Volunteers cut a horn of one of the animals to set the pair free —Photo: Special Arrangement

After a fight on a Monday afternoon, two buffaloes ended up lying on the road in Gandhi Nagar in Madipakkam, their horns locked. They were helpless, unable to extricate themselves until volunteers came to their aid.

“The animals were in a bad condition when we found them,” said Dawn William from Blue Cross.

“The neck of one of the animals was caught in the other’s horns and they both looked suffocated. Luckily, we were informed on time,” he said.

Around 3 p.m., volunteers from Blue Cross rushed to Gandhi Nagar, Madipakkam, and began their work to separate the animals, which had been stuck for four hours.

They took out a hacksaw blade and cut a horn of one of the animals and set them free.

“It was a miracle that they even survived. Going by past incidents of this nature, one animal dies,” said Dawn.

The volunteers later fed the stray buffaloes with water and sent them away in opposite directions.
title: Buffaloes lock horns, lie on road for four hours
